results.title: And now Miguel
results.creator_credit: Joseph Krumgold and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: A portrait of an American family to whom the tradition of sheep raising has come down through generations of Spanish ancestors. It is the story of family unity, and of young Miguel and the fulfillment of his dream of being accepted on an equal footing by his father and brothers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Krumgold and United States Information Agency

results.title: And justice for all [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Norman Jewison and Patrick Palmer
results.brief_description: Al Pacino plays Arthur Kirkland, an attorney who experiences firsthand corruption of the establishment that he works for. Burdened with the memory of clients who’ve suffered heinously at the hands of inefficient bureaucracy, Kirkland starts to realise how systemic the depravity is among his colleagues. Whilst defending a repulsive judge (whom he loathes for personal reasons) on a rape and battery charge, Kirkland is forced to decide whether or not he will become another a cog in the amoral wheel of justice. For Pacino this role was one of several he played in unsettling dramas, produced in the 1970s, that addressed urban angst, endemic judicial venality and the demise of the American dream. Directed by prolific Canadian filmmaker Norman Jewison (Fiddler on the roof, Moonstruck, Rollerball, Iceman, Jesus Christ Superstar), whose films have at times addressed issues of racial injustice in America (In the heat of the night, A Soldiers story, The Hurricane). Conceived as a satire, the screenplay for the film was co-written by director Barry Levinson, who along with Valerie Curtin was nominated for an Academy Award.

results.title: And I cried
results.brief_description: We live in a world besieged and besotted by image. Everyone, it seems, wants their fifteen minutes and plenty of people will do whatever it takes to get a piece of the celebrity cake. “And I cried” is a film about wishing to be a movie star. Being a star is about shining bright, a brilliant flash of light against a velvety black night sky. “And I cried” is an exploration, a celebration, a lamentation, of our obsession with the star and the image. Cast includes: Cassandra Tytler, Engelbert Schmidl, Dominic Redfern, Shane Hennessey.

results.title: And how do you feel at the end of the week?
results.creator_credit: John Filmer-Mason, Filmedia (Australia), Productivity Promotion Council of Australia and Kara Feldman
results.brief_description: Billy works in a factory and is dissatisfied with his job. His girlfriend works in a shop and has remedied the deficiencies in her work situation to make her job challenging and meaningful. Shows the relationship between job satisfaction and performance and how employees and management can communicate to create a more productive work environment.

results.title: And he will rise again
results.brief_description: Easter in the modern world. The meaning of Easter is the manifold sacrifice of God and Man in the person of Jesus, atoning for the sins of mankind. Unfortunately this meaning escapes many younger Australians. Both the passion of Christ and the meaning of Easter contrast the nonchalant reality of the young people, who drift throught the Easter weekend without a thought for its ‘sacred’ significance and its application to their relatively empty lives. Written by Peter Tammer, camera by Tom Cowan and organ by Harold Fabrikant.

results.title: And God created great whales
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Observations of the killer whale in captivity and in the sea indicate that it is both gregarious and intelligent. Its survival is now threatened

results.title: Ancient Tashkent: an impression
results.brief_description: For a relatively short time Tashkent was a great market city on the spice route from China to Europe. This lyrical non-narrative film draws in viewers to experience for themselves the richness of its mosaics and the grandeur of its architecture. Makes imaginitive use of authentic Uzbek music.

results.title: Ancient Rome
results.brief_description: As a city, religious centre, and capital of an empire, Ancient Rome dominated the people of its times. The achievements of Rome in government, architecture, engineering, and law are summarized, and our own inheritances from Roman culture established.

results.title: Ancient religions of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
This documentary turns its focus back into history to examine the diverse spiritual traditions of ancient Mediterranean cultures, and offer insight as to how the rituals and belief systems of these societies may have influenced modern religions such as Christianity, Islam and Judaism. Humanity’s basic desire to co-exist in harmony with the natural world was one of the primary factors involved with the increasing worship and deification of animal spirits. Agricultural advances saw wild animals - and therefore, wild spirits - being simultaneously domesticated. Gods and goddesses portrayed in a more accessible human form, or in a human form merged with that of an animal, grew in popularity. From Mesopotamia and Egypt to the Greek and Roman empires, different forms of worship, underpinned by similar archetypal myths and images, flourished and expanded. Narrated by Ben Kingsley. Includes teacher’s notes.
